applications.name: .NET
applications.notes: Instrumented demo app with injection scenarios.

applications.name: Java
applications.notes: Planned Spring Boot + Easy Travel profile.

attacks.name: SQL injection
attacks.summary: Manipulate query logic to extract or alter data at runtime.

variants.name: Union-based
variants.description: Blend attacker-controlled results into a legitimate query.
variants.example: ' UNION SELECT user, password FROM accounts --

variants.name: Boolean blind
variants.description: Infer data via true/false logic when errors are hidden.

variants.name: Time-based blind
variants.description: Delay responses to confirm injectable parameters.

attacks.name: Command injection
attacks.summary: Abuse system calls to execute arbitrary commands.

variants.name: Inline chaining
variants.description: Append shell operators to extend a command.

variants.name: Subshell
variants.description: Use shell interpolation to execute nested commands.

attacks.name: Server-side request forgery
attacks.summary: Force servers to reach internal or cloud metadata targets.

variants.name: Metadata probe
variants.description: Query cloud metadata endpoints to discover secrets.

variants.name: Internal pivot
variants.description: Reach services bound to private IP ranges.

attacks.name: JNDI injection
attacks.summary: Trigger remote lookups that can load unexpected code paths.

variants.name: LDAP lookup
variants.description: Use attacker-controlled LDAP endpoints for resolution.

variants.name: RMI lookup
variants.description: Leverage RMI endpoints to chain serialization behavior.

attacks.name: Insecure deserialization
attacks.summary: Inject crafted objects that execute gadget chains.

variants.name: Gadget chain
variants.description: Trigger known gadget chains in serialized payloads.
variants.example: Binary payload with embedded gadget sequence

variants.name: Type confusion
variants.description: Swap expected types to reach unsafe code paths.
variants.example: JSON object with unexpected class hint
